Description: Bust of Caracalla, laureate, draped and cuirassed, right, seen from behind. (obverse)

Caracalla, in military dress, standing left, right foot on crocodile, holding vertical spear in left hand and extending right hand to Isis, advancing left, holding corn-ears in right hand and sistrum in left hand. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: The depiction of Isis greeting the emperor is a reference to Caracalla's visit to Egypt in this year. The crocodile under his foot is probably an allusion to riots in Alexandria that were suppressed with great ferocity.
Bibliographic references: RE5 / Coins of the Roman Empire in the British Museum, vol.V: Pertinax to Elagabalus (288, p.487)
RIC4 / The Roman imperial coinage, vol. 4: Pertinax - Uranius Antonius (544, p.303) (type)
